subject: Real Estate
title: The 2008 Housing Crash
description: A short lesson to help you apply The 2008 Housing Crash.

hook.text: By 2006, U.S. home prices had doubled in a decade. Everyone believed houses only go up.

buildup.text: Banks gave mortgages to anyone with a pulse, then bundled the loans into securities and sold them.

discovery.text: When borrowers defaulted, the securities collapsed. Banks that held them faced instant insolvency.

twist.text: Lehman Brothers filed the largest bankruptcy in history. Global credit markets froze overnight.

climax.text: Nine million Americans lost their homes. The crash erased $7 trillion in household wealth.

punchline.text: A house isn't an ATM â€” 2008 proved it.
